title: Latitude brokers send book message, demand "exceeds offer size"
text:
Joint lead managers for initial public offering hopeful Latitude Financial Group have sent a message to prospective listed equities investors.

The message, which was sent at 1213pm on Tuesday morning, said:

Demand – comprising early indications of demand and firm orders in the book – currently exceeds the expected offer size, assuming $330million is allocated to retail.

The retail networks have been asked to confirm their broker firm allocations over the course of today, following lodgement of the supplementary prospectus overnight,

It comes as brokers Goldman Sachs, Macquarie Capital and UBS seek to raise $1.037 billion, having blasted terms to fund managers and formally opened the books on Monday night for what will be the year's biggest sharemarket float, if successful.

As Street Talk revealed on Monday morning, Latitude's big three investors and brokers decided to reprice the deal to $1.78 following talks with potential investors over the weekend.

The new price represented 11-times forward cash profit, a 5.8 per cent dividend yield and, if successful, would see the listed Latitude worth $3.165 billion. It was cut from $2 a share or 12.4-times profit.

The proposed structure would see KKR own 21.4 per cent of the business on listing, while Varde Partners would have 21.5 per cent and Deutsche Bank 13.5 per cent.
